sn46.21:1.1.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.21:1.1.eng: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and said to him:

sn46.21:2.2.eng: How are the awakening factors defined?”

sn46.21:2.3.pli: “‘Bodhāya saṃvattantī’ti kho, bhikkhu, tasmā bojjhaṅgāti vuccanti.
sn46.21:2.3.eng: “Mendicant, they’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.

sn46.21:2.4.eng: A mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.21:2.5.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.21:2.5.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.21:2.6.eng: They’re called awakening factors because they lead to awakening.”

sn46.22:0.3.eng: A Teaching on the Awakening Factors

sn46.22:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you the seven awakening factors.

sn46.22:1.3.eng: And what are the seven awakening factors?

sn46.22:1.4.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.22:1.5.eng: These are the seven awakening factors.”

sn46.23:1.1.pli: “Kāmarāgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppanno ceva kāmacchando uppajjati, uppanno ca kāmacchando bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati.
sn46.23:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for sensual greed, sensual desire arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.

sn46.23:1.2.pli: Byāpādaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppanno ceva byāpādo uppajjati, uppanno ca byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati.
sn46.23:1.2.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for ill will, ill will arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.

sn46.23:1.3.pli: Thinamiddhaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppannañceva thinamiddhaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati.
sn46.23:1.3.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for dullness and drowsiness, dullness and drowsiness arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.

sn46.23:1.4.pli: Uddhaccakukkuccaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppannañceva uddhaccakukkuccaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati.
sn46.23:1.4.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for restlessness and remorse, restlessness and remorse arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.

sn46.23:1.5.pli: Vicikicchāṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppannā ceva vicikicchā uppajjati, uppannā ca vicikicchā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati.
sn46.23:1.5.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for doubt, doubt arises, and once arisen it increases and grows.

sn46.23:2.1.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppanno ceva satisambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca satisambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati …pe…
sn46.23:2.1.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for the awakening factor of mindfulness, the awakening factor of mindfulness arises, and once arisen it’s fully developed. …

sn46.23:2.2.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṭṭhāniyānaṃ, bhikkhave, dhammānaṃ manasikārabahulīkārā anuppanno ceva upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchatī”ti.
sn46.23:2.2.eng: When you frequently apply the mind to things that are grounds for the awakening factor of equanimity, the awakening factor of equanimity arises, and once arisen it’s fully developed.”

sn46.24:1.1.pli: “Ayoniso, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppanno ceva kāmacchando uppajjati, uppanno ca kāmacchando bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati;
sn46.24:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when you apply the mind irrationally, sensual desire,

sn46.24:1.2.pli: anuppanno ceva byāpādo uppajjati, uppanno ca byāpādo bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati;

sn46.24:1.3.pli: anuppannañceva thinamiddhaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca thinamiddhaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati;

sn46.24:1.4.pli: anuppannañceva uddhaccakukkuccaṃ uppajjati, uppannañca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati;

sn46.24:1.5.pli: anuppannā ceva vicikicchā uppajjati, uppannā ca vicikicchā bhiyyobhāvāya vepullāya saṃvattati;
sn46.24:1.5.eng: and doubt arise, and once arisen they increase and grow.

sn46.24:1.6.pli: anuppanno ceva satisambojjhaṅgo nuppajjati, uppanno ca satisambojjhaṅgo nirujjhati …pe… anuppanno ceva upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo nuppajjati, uppanno ca upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo nirujjhati.
sn46.24:1.6.eng: And the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity don’t arise, or if they’ve already arisen, they cease.

sn46.24:2.1.pli: Yoniso ca kho, bhikkhave, manasikaroto anuppanno ceva kāmacchando nuppajjati, uppanno ca kāmacchando pahīyati;
sn46.24:2.1.eng: When you apply the mind rationally, sensual desire,

sn46.24:2.2.pli: anuppanno ceva byāpādo nuppajjati, uppanno ca byāpādo pahīyati;

sn46.24:2.3.pli: anuppannañceva thinamiddhaṃ nuppajjati, uppannañca thinamiddhaṃ pahīyati;

sn46.24:2.4.pli: anuppannañceva uddhaccakukkuccaṃ nuppajjati, uppannañca uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahīyati;

sn46.24:2.5.pli: anuppannā ceva vicikicchā nuppajjati, uppannā ca vicikicchā pahīyati.
sn46.24:2.5.eng: and doubt don’t arise, or if they’ve already arisen they’re given up.

sn46.24:3.1.pli: Anuppanno ceva satisambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca satisambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati …pe… anuppanno ceva upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo uppajjati, uppanno ca upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchatī”ti.
sn46.24:3.1.eng: And the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity arise, and once they’ve arisen, they’re fully developed.”

sn46.25:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you seven principles that prevent decline.

sn46.25:1.3.pli: Katame ca, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā?
sn46.25:1.3.eng: And what are the seven principles that prevent decline?

sn46.25:1.5.eng: They are the seven awakening factors.

sn46.25:1.7.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.25:1.8.pli: ime kho, bhikkhave, satta aparihāniyā dhammā”ti.
sn46.25:1.8.eng: These are the seven principles that prevent decline.”

sn46.26:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, maggo yā paṭipadā taṇhakkhayāya saṃvattati, taṃ maggaṃ taṃ paṭipadaṃ bhāvetha.
sn46.26:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, you should develop the path and the practice that leads to the ending of craving.

sn46.26:1.2.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, maggo katamā ca paṭipadā taṇhakkhayāya saṃvattati?
sn46.26:1.2.eng: And what is the path and the practice that leads to the ending of craving?

sn46.26:1.4.eng: It is the seven awakening factors.

sn46.26:1.6.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.”

sn46.26:1.7.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.26:1.7.eng: When he said this, Udāyī said to him:

sn46.26:1.8.pli: “kathaṃ bhāvitā nu kho, bhante, satta bojjhaṅgā, kathaṃ bahulīkatā taṇhakkhayāya saṃvattantī”ti?
sn46.26:1.8.eng: “Sir, how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to lead to the ending of craving?”

sn46.26:2.1.pli: “Idha, udāyi, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ.
sn46.26:2.1.eng: “Udāyī, it’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. And it is abundant, expansive, limitless, and free of ill will.

sn46.26:2.2.pli: Tassa satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvayato vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ taṇhā pahīyati.
sn46.26:2.2.eng: As they do so, craving is given up.

sn46.26:2.3.eng: When craving is given up, deeds are given up.

sn46.26:2.4.eng: When deeds are given up, suffering is given up. …

sn46.26:2.5.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ.
sn46.26:2.5.eng: A mendicant develops the awakening factor of equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. And it is abundant, expansive, limitless, and free of ill will.

sn46.26:2.6.pli: Tassa upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvayato vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ taṇhā pahīyati
sn46.26:2.6.eng: As they do so, craving is given up.

sn46.26:2.7.eng: When craving is given up, deeds are given up.

sn46.26:2.8.eng: When deeds are given up, suffering is given up.

sn46.26:2.9.pli: Iti kho, udāyi, taṇhakkhayā kammakkhayo, kammakkhayā dukkhakkhayo”ti.
sn46.26:2.9.eng: And so, Udāyī, when craving ends, deeds end; when deeds end suffering ends.”

sn46.27:1.1.pli: “Yo, bhikkhave, maggo yā paṭipadā taṇhānirodhāya saṃvattati, taṃ maggaṃ taṃ paṭipadaṃ bhāvetha.
sn46.27:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, you should develop the path and the practice that leads to the cessation of craving.

sn46.27:1.2.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, maggo katamā ca paṭipadā taṇhānirodhāya saṃvattati?
sn46.27:1.2.eng: And what is the path and the practice that leads to the cessation of craving?

sn46.27:1.4.eng: It is the seven awakening factors.

sn46.27:1.6.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.27:1.7.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā taṇhānirodhāya saṃvattanti?
sn46.27:1.7.eng: And how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to lead to the cessation of craving?

sn46.27:2.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ …pe…
sn46.27:2.1.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.27:2.2.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.27:2.2.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.27:2.3.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā evaṃ bahulīkatā taṇhānirodhāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.27:2.3.eng: This is how the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to lead to the cessation of craving.”

sn46.28:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I will teach you a path that helps penetration.

sn46.28:1.3.eng: And what is the path that helps penetration?

sn46.28:1.5.eng: It is the seven awakening factors.

sn46.28:1.7.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.”

sn46.28:1.8.pli: Evaṃ vutte, āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.28:1.8.eng: When he said this, Udāyī said to him:

sn46.28:1.9.pli: “kathaṃ bhāvitā nu kho, bhante, satta bojjhaṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā nibbedhāya saṃvattantī”ti?
sn46.28:1.9.eng: “Sir, how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to lead to penetration?”

sn46.28:2.1.pli: “Idha, udāyi, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ.
sn46.28:2.1.eng: “Udāyī, it’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. And it is abundant, expansive, limitless, and free of ill will.

sn46.28:2.2.pli: So satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvitena cittena anibbiddhapubbaṃ appadālitapubbaṃ lobhakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāleti;
sn46.28:2.2.eng: With a mind that has developed the awakening factor of mindfulness, they penetrate and shatter the mass of greed,

sn46.28:2.4.eng: and the mass of delusion for the first time. …

sn46.28:2.5.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ vipulaṃ mahaggataṃ appamāṇaṃ abyāpajjaṃ.
sn46.28:2.5.eng: A mendicant develops the awakening factor of equanimity, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go. And it is abundant, expansive, limitless, and free of ill will.

sn46.28:2.6.pli: So upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvitena cittena anibbiddhapubbaṃ appadālitapubbaṃ lobhakkhandhaṃ nibbijjhati padāleti;
sn46.28:2.6.eng: With a mind that has developed the awakening factor of equanimity, they penetrate and shatter the mass of greed,

sn46.28:2.8.eng: and the mass of delusion for the first time.

sn46.28:2.9.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, udāyi, satta bojjhaṅgā evaṃ bahulīkatā nibbedhāya saṃvattantī”ti.
sn46.28:2.9.eng: This is how are the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to lead to penetration.”

sn46.29:1.1.pli: “Nāhaṃ, bhikkhave, aññaṃ ekadhammampi samanupassāmi, yo evaṃ bhāvito bahulīkato saṃyojanīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya saṃvattati, yathayidaṃ, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā.
sn46.29:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, I do not see a single thing that, when it is developed and cultivated like this, leads to giving up the things that tighten the fetters like the seven awakening factors.

sn46.29:1.3.eng: The awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.29:1.4.pli: Kathaṃ bhāvitā ca, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā kathaṃ bahulīkatā saṃyojanīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya saṃvattanti?
sn46.29:1.4.eng: And how are the seven awakening factors developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the things that tighten the fetters?

sn46.29:2.1.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn46.29:2.1.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.29:2.2.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.29:2.2.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.29:2.3.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitā kho, bhikkhave, satta bojjhaṅgā evaṃ bahulīkatā saṃyojanīyānaṃ dhammānaṃ pahānāya saṃvattanti.
sn46.29:2.3.eng: That’s how the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated so as to lead to giving up the things that tighten the fetters.

sn46.29:3.1.eng: And what are the things that tighten the fetters?

sn46.29:3.2.eng: The eye is something that tightens the fetters.

sn46.29:3.3.eng: This is where these fetters, shackles, and attachments arise.

sn46.29:3.6.eng: mind is something that tightens the fetters.

sn46.29:3.7.eng: This is where these fetters, shackles, and attachments arise.

sn46.29:3.8.eng: These are called the things that tighten the fetters.”

sn46.3:1.1.pli: “Ye te, bhikkhave, bhikkhū sīlasampannā samādhisampannā ñāṇasampannā vimuttisampannā vimuttiñāṇadassanasampannā, dassanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi;
sn46.3:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, when a mendicant is accomplished in ethics, immersion, knowledge, freedom, or the knowledge and vision of freedom, even the sight of them is very helpful, I say.

sn46.3:1.2.pli: savanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi;

sn46.3:1.3.pli: upasaṅkamanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi;

sn46.3:1.4.pli: payirupāsanampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi;

sn46.3:1.5.pli: anussatimpāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi;

sn46.3:1.6.pli: anupabbajjampāhaṃ, bhikkhave, tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ bahukāraṃ vadāmi.
sn46.3:1.6.eng: or go forth following them is very helpful, I say.

sn46.3:1.8.pli: Tathārūpānaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ dhammaṃ sutvā dvayena vūpakāsena vūpakaṭṭho viharati—kāyavūpakāsena ca cittavūpakāsena ca.
sn46.3:1.8.eng: Because after hearing the teaching of such mendicants, a mendicant will live withdrawn in both body and mind,

sn46.3:1.9.pli: So tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi.
sn46.3:1.9.eng: as they recollect and think about that teaching.

sn46.3:2.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā vūpakaṭṭho viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ anussarati anuvitakketi, satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti;
sn46.3:2.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of mindfulness;

sn46.3:2.3.pli: satisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn46.3:2.4.pli: So tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati.
sn46.3:2.4.eng: As they live mindfully in this way they investigate, explore, and inquire into that teaching with wisdom.

sn46.3:3.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathā sato viharanto taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinati pavicarati parivīmaṃsamāpajjati, dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti;
sn46.3:3.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of investigation of principles;

sn46.3:3.3.pli: dhammavicayasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.

sn46.3:3.4.pli: Tassa taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinato pavicarato parivīmaṃsamāpajjato āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ.
sn46.3:3.4.eng: As they investigate principles with wisdom in this way their energy is roused up and unflagging.

sn46.3:4.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno taṃ dhammaṃ paññāya pavicinato pavicarato parivīmaṃsamāpajjato āraddhaṃ hoti vīriyaṃ asallīnaṃ, vīriyasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti; vīriyasambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti; vīriyasambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.3:4.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of energy; they develop it and perfect it.

sn46.3:4.2.eng: When they’re energetic, rapture not of the flesh arises.

sn46.3:5.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno āraddhavīriyassa uppajjati pīti nirāmisā, pītisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti; pītisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti; pītisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.3:5.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of rapture; they develop it and perfect it.

sn46.3:5.2.eng: When the mind is full of rapture, the body and mind become tranquil.

sn46.3:6.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pītimanassa kāyopi passambhati cittampi passambhati, passaddhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti; passaddhisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti; passaddhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.3:6.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of tranquility; they develop it and perfect it.

sn46.3:6.2.eng: When the body is tranquil and one feels bliss, the mind becomes immersed in samādhi.

sn46.3:7.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno passaddhakāyassa sukhino cittaṃ samādhiyati, samādhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti; samādhisambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti; samādhisambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.3:7.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of immersion; they develop it and perfect it.

sn46.3:7.2.pli: So tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.
sn46.3:7.2.eng: They closely watch over that mind immersed in samādhi.

sn46.3:8.1.pli: Yasmiṃ samaye, bhikkhave, bhikkhu tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti, upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno āraddho hoti; upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhu bhāveti; upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo tasmiṃ samaye bhikkhuno bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchati.
sn46.3:8.1.eng: At such a time, a mendicant has activated the awakening factor of equanimity; they develop it and perfect it.

sn46.3:9.1.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitesu kho, bhikkhave, sattasu sambojjhaṅgesu evaṃ bahulīkatesu satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā.
sn46.3:9.1.eng: When the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated in this way they can expect seven fruits and benefits.

sn46.3:9.3.eng: They attain enlightenment early on in this very life.

sn46.3:9.4.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, atha maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti.
sn46.3:9.4.eng: If not, they attain enlightenment at the time of death.

sn46.3:9.5.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti, atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti.
sn46.3:9.5.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters, they’re extinguished between one life and the next.

sn46.3:9.6.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti.
sn46.3:9.6.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished upon landing.

sn46.3:9.7.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
sn46.3:9.7.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished without extra effort.

sn46.3:9.8.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti.
sn46.3:9.8.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters they’re extinguished with extra effort.

sn46.3:9.9.pli: No ce diṭṭheva dhamme paṭikacca aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce maraṇakāle aññaṃ ārādheti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā antarāparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā upahaccaparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā asaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, no ce pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā sasaṅkhāraparinibbāyī hoti, atha pañcannaṃ orambhāgiyānaṃ saṃyojanānaṃ parikkhayā uddhaṃsoto hoti akaniṭṭhagāmī.
sn46.3:9.9.eng: If not, with the ending of the five lower fetters they head upstream, going to the Akaniṭṭha realm.

sn46.3:9.10.pli: Evaṃ bhāvitesu kho, bhikkhave, sattasu bojjhaṅgesu evaṃ bahulīkatesu ime satta phalā sattānisaṃsā pāṭikaṅkhā”ti.
sn46.3:9.10.eng: When the seven awakening factors are developed and cultivated in this way these are the seven fruits and benefits they can expect.”

sn46.30:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sumbhesu viharati setakaṃ nāma sumbhānaṃ nigamo.
sn46.30:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas named Sedaka.

sn46.30:1.2.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe… ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā udāyī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
sn46.30:1.2.eng: Then Venerable Udāyī went up to the Buddha … and said to him:

sn46.30:2.2.pli: Yāva bahukatañca me, bhante, bhagavati pemañca gāravo ca hirī ca ottappañca.
sn46.30:2.2.eng: How helpful my love and respect for the Buddha have been, and my sense of conscience and prudence.

sn46.30:2.3.pli: Ahañhi, bhante, pubbe agārikabhūto samāno abahukato ahosiṃ dhammena abahukato saṅghena.
sn46.30:2.3.eng: For when I was still a layman, I wasn’t helped much by the teaching or the Saṅgha.

sn46.30:2.4.pli: So khvāhaṃ bhagavati pemañca gāravañca hiriñca ottappañca sampassamāno agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito.
sn46.30:2.4.eng: But when I considered my love and respect for the Buddha, and my sense of conscience and prudence, I went forth from the lay life to homelessness.

sn46.30:2.5.eng: The Buddha taught me the Dhamma:

sn46.30:2.6.pli: ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅgamo;
sn46.30:2.6.eng: ‘Such is form, such is the origin of form, such is the disappearance of form.

sn46.30:2.10.pli: iti viññāṇaṃ, iti viññāṇassa samudayo, iti viññāṇassa atthaṅgamo’ti.
sn46.30:2.10.eng: Such is consciousness, such is the origin of consciousness, such is the disappearance of consciousness.’

sn46.30:3.1.pli: So khvāhaṃ, bhante, suññāgāragato imesaṃ pañcupādānakkhandhānaṃ ukkujjāvakujjaṃ samparivattento ‘idaṃ dukkhan’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhasamudayo’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodho’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ, ‘ayaṃ dukkhanirodhagāminī paṭipadā’ti yathābhūtaṃ abbhaññāsiṃ.
sn46.30:3.1.eng: Then, while staying in an empty hut, I followed the churning of the five grasping aggregates. I truly understood: ‘This is suffering’ … ‘This is the origin of suffering’ … ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ … ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’.

sn46.30:3.2.pli: Dhammo ca me, bhante, abhisamito, maggo ca me paṭiladdho;
sn46.30:3.2.eng: I comprehended the teaching; I acquired the path.

sn46.30:3.3.pli: yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
sn46.30:3.3.eng: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

sn46.30:3.4.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi.
sn46.30:3.4.eng: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn46.30:4.1.pli: Satisambojjhaṅgo me, bhante, paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
sn46.30:4.1.eng: I acquired the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion, and equanimity.

sn46.30:4.2.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi …pe…

sn46.30:4.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgo me, bhante, paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
sn46.30:4.3.eng: When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, they will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

sn46.30:4.4.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmi.
sn46.30:4.4.eng: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’

sn46.30:4.5.pli: Ayaṃ kho me, bhante, maggo paṭiladdho, yo me bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathāhaṃ:
sn46.30:4.5.eng: This is the path that I acquired. When developed and cultivated as I’m living in such a way, it will bring me to such a state that I will understand:

sn46.30:4.6.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissāmī”ti.
sn46.30:4.6.eng: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn46.30:5.2.pli: Eso hi te, udāyi, maggo paṭiladdho, yo te bhāvito bahulīkato tathā tathā viharantaṃ tathattāya upanessati yathā tvaṃ:
sn46.30:5.2.eng: For that is indeed the path that you acquired. When developed and cultivated as you’re living in such a way, it will bring you to such a state that you will understand:

sn46.30:5.3.pli: ‘khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānissasī”ti.
sn46.30:5.3.eng: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is nothing further for this place.’”

sn46.31:1.1.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, dhammā kusalā kusalabhāgiyā kusalapakkhikā, sabbe te appamādamūlakā appamādasamosaraṇā; appamādo tesaṃ dhammānaṃ aggamakkhāyati.
sn46.31:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, whatever qualities are skillful, part of the skillful, on the side of the skillful, all of them are rooted in diligence and meet at diligence, and diligence is said to be the best of them.

sn46.31:1.2.pli: Appamattassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.
sn46.31:1.2.eng: A mendicant who is diligent can expect to develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.

sn46.31:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu appamatto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
sn46.31:2.1.eng: And how does a diligent mendicant develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?

sn46.31:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn46.31:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.31:2.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.31:2.3.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.31:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu appamatto satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
sn46.31:2.4.eng: That’s how a diligent mendicant develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”

sn46.32:1.1.pli: “Ye keci, bhikkhave, dhammā kusalā kusalabhāgiyā kusalapakkhikā, sabbe te yonisomanasikāramūlakā yonisomanasikārasamosaraṇā; yonisomanasikāro tesaṃ dhammānaṃ aggamakkhāyati.
sn46.32:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, whatever qualities are skillful, part of the skillful, on the side of the skillful, all of them are rooted in rational application of mind and meet at rational application of mind, and rational application of mind is said to be the best of them.

sn46.32:1.2.pli: Yonisomanasikārasampannassetaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno pāṭikaṅkhaṃ—satta bojjhaṅge bhāvessati, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarissati.
sn46.32:1.2.eng: A mendicant accomplished in rational application of mind can expect to develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors.

sn46.32:2.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkaroti?
sn46.32:2.1.eng: And how does a mendicant with rational application of mind develop and cultivate the seven awakening factors?

sn46.32:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ …pe…
sn46.32:2.2.eng: It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, immersion,

sn46.32:2.3.pli: upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
sn46.32:2.3.eng: and equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

sn46.32:2.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yonisomanasikārasampanno satta bojjhaṅge bhāveti, satta bojjhaṅge bahulīkarotī”ti.
sn46.32:2.4.eng: That’s how a mendicant with rational application of mind develops and cultivates the seven awakening factors.”
